Articles.Content:
Whenever I start drilling it makes me go underground, then once i enter into "physics" i get thrown into the air

On Ike

 

https://streamable.com/cbbey

Video Above

P.S. Jebediah Died 

Edited October 3, 2017 by Hugo Kerman

Moving to Tech Support (modded installs).

It may help if you provide a copy of your output_log file (should be situated in KSP_x64_Data in your KSP folder if you're running 64 bit).

Simple. Your drills are underground, timewarping stops physics so the game doesn't have to run calculations 100000 times as fast. The game is now unable to determine if you should be on the surface or under it, so it glitches out.

14 minutes ago, Mrcarrot said:

Simple. Your drills are underground, timewarping stops physics so the game doesn't have to run calculations 100000 times as fast. The game is now unable to determine if you should be on the surface or under it, so it glitches out.

Shouldn't matter, I've been timewarping all the time with the drills working. You could try to place them a little bit higher on the craft, maybe that solves the problem.

1 minute ago, DrLicor said:

Shouldn't matter, I've been timewarping all the time with the drills working. You could try to place them a little bit higher on the craft, maybe that solves the problem.

Just seemed like the solution to me. Also, have you done it on Ike? I'm going to try to replicate his glitch today.

3 hours ago, DrLicor said:

Shouldn't matter, I've been timewarping all the time with the drills working. You could try to place them a little bit higher on the craft, maybe that solves the problem.

Surely it matter, part clips into the surface and when physics kicks in the craft may explore or jump into space. 

Raising the drills is indeed a probable solution since looks like that is the part clipping into the surface.
Thanks for the answers, I tried to do it with just one drill and it worked for some reason.
